cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 560 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest to north-northwest across the central and north-western Gulf toward the Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Upper Texas / Southwest Louisiana coast near Sea Rim State Park TX – Intracoastal City LA (close to Port Arthur area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City LA; Storm-surge watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and Mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm-surge Warning from San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (includes Port Arthur area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline from Port Bolivar TX eastward to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (sustained 75-100+ mph possible) likely Wednesday night–Thursday with damaging gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 9–13 ft possible in Sabine Lake/Port Arthur area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and destructive waves, dangerous rip currents, and the potential for inland tornadoes Thursday.
